info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 4:37PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Granite and southeastern Powell Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 436 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Garrison, or 10 miles northwest of Deer Lodge, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Garrison, Avon, Brock Creek, and Goldcreek. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 165 and 178. Highway 12 Garrison to MacDonald Pass between mile markers 0 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
